primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The enforcement of a conditional covenant (the 'If') where the survival of the community depends on moral performance and neighbor-care.

tekstueel_bewijs: If you obey my voice... you shall be my treasured possession
If you turn aside... then I will cut Israel off
what we do with that hard, uncompromising 'if' is an issue
establish your royal throne over Israel forever
vitality and fruitfulness and abundance and rain

zender.identificatie: The God of Moses (The Sovereign Lawgiver)
tekstueel_bewijs: the God who refused to be domesticated
God’s freedom and God’s sovereignty, God’s moral demand
the future of Jerusalem is set
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Subject who must fulfill the 'If'.

tekstueel_bewijs: the hutzpah of poets who offer no intellectual justification
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Sender/Opponent (Judge), not the Helper.

tegenstander.identificatie: Numbness, Narcotic Faith, and Economic Greed
tekstueel_bewijs: numbed and falsely assured by their faith
their casual, uncritical faith had become for them a narcotic
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily a psychological and social state of 'not noticing' rather than an ontological power of sin.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Poet's task to awaken the numbed public through 'haunting poetry'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Preacher/Poet
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (preaching) serves to activate the primary program (the hearer's moral obligation).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God of Moses → Moral Order/Survival → The Numbed City

voorbeelden_god_subject: I will establish your royal throne
God speaks here in such an odd voice
voorbeelden_mens_subject: they do not judge with justice
we soon and late rush our heads against the wall

voorbeelden: insists upon moral reality that cannot be evaded
those most uninterested in any serious sense-making
It would be better not to know... but having known, the poet cannot un-know

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Mandate' narrative. It focuses almost exclusively on the obligation (Devoir) and the lack of knowledge (Savoir), assuming that if the hearer 'notices' the obligation, they must act.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From ~S2 (False Unconditionality) to ~S1 (Numbness) to S1 (The Hard If) and finally hovering at S2 (Punishment).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Unresolved. The sermon ends on a question of punishment, refusing the path to Grace.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high. S2 (Punishment) is the 'haunting' reality used to motivate the Subject.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: Despite the sophisticated rhetorical framing, the actantial 'engine' is purely conditional. God is the judge/sender of a mandate, and the human is the subject who must perform to achieve the object of survival.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: In the very fabric of this faith is the awareness that it costs to live with God.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: God as Instrument of Moral Order
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Yahweh gets back into the game only because of the poet who now 're-speaks' the God of Sinai.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: I am the one who has tamed chaos... I do it all the time.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jeremiah is presented as the model of the 'seeing' and 'uttering' subject that the church must emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: A theocentric reading would focus on God as the one who gives sight to the blind (Jeremiah) and who fulfills the 'If' on behalf of the numbed city.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Anxiety and 'trembling'; a sense of heavy moral burden.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is contingent upon human 'noticing' and 'neighbor-care'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is highly coherent in its moralism; it consistently rejects 'unconditional' grace as a narcotic.
spanning_punten: The mention of Easter (v. 22b) clashes with the overall conditional 'If' structure.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The awakening is to the raw fact that all the self-preoccupation has not driven God’s relentless 'if' off the map.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The preacher assumes the hearer has the power (Pouvoir) if they only have the will (Vouloir) and knowledge (Savoir).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is defined as 'stupidity', 'numbness', and 'economic abuse'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'Law' event. God is the Judge, the Hearer is the Subject, and the 'If' is the barrier to the Object.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the subject of 'surviving' and 'noticing'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the Subject of the 'un-numbing'.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'we must notice', use 'God pierces our numbness to show us the neighbor.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the one who must 'talk sense' to the city.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Position the hearer as the one who has failed the 'If' and needs the God who 'tames chaos' to intervene.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Move from 'It costs to live with God' to 'God paid the cost so we can live.'

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already takes the opponent seriously, but lacks a Subject strong enough to defeat it.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The 'Secondary Program' (Ethics) has swallowed the 'Primary Program' (Soteriology).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Proclaim the God who fulfills the covenant (Soteriology) first, then the response of the poet (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically brilliant but theologically legalistic. It recovers the 'fear of God' but loses the 'Gospel of God'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would praise the 'poetry' and 'prophetic edge'; Greimas reveals the 'If' is a structural trap.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might confirm the conditional nature of Jeremiah 5, but semiotics shows the preacher has made that conditionality the 'engine' of the sermon itself.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that 'God' is used here as a literary device to enforce human moral behavior rather than as the active Subject of salvation.

appendices.notities: The sermon explicitly attacks 'unconditional' grace as a 'narcotic', making its moralistic structure intentional.
